article_metadata.description: As hospital mergers and acquisitions gather steam in the Hudson Valley, people can expect to see fewer medical centers, more urgent-care locations, and small practices dying out or being absorbed into larger ones, experts say.Doctors will increasingly become hospital employees rather than independent practitioners, and the region will have four or five hospitals that are behemoths, rather than the current 40-odd smaller ones."It's an oligopoly model," said Paul Savage, president of
article_metadata.author: Hema Easley Times Herald-Record
